txt.en:
'[placeholder], I hear you're interested in some fine clothing. You have good taste! If you help me, I'll see that you're wearing the finest style that Winter-home has to offer.

'I need your help, you see. When I came into my mayorship, I ignorantly put town money into unstable investments. I let go many workers, but the town is still in trouble. That's why the festival is here -- to raise money! 

'I keep promising them that the festival will help the town, which will let them have their normal wages back. But first I must use the festival profits to get out of my own debt. A southerner told me that there is a very promising investment to be made in a war that seems to be brewing in faraway lands.

'Sadly, the festival didn't raise enough for me to invest properly, so I need to cut back on the workforce again. Can you get some dirt on any disloyal workers? I hear that they trust you....'

'Oh, if it isn't the mayor's particular friend! I'm surprised he hasn't adopted you as part of the Goodnough family. That's right -- I saw you talking at length with the mayor.\n\n'I've nothing to say to you. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have work to do.'

'Ah, [placeholder]. I am terribly sorry for the way my friend Gareth just spoke to you. He is very unhappy, you see. Many folks are, and it troubles my heart.\n\n'Nay, don't listen to my ramblings. It is just the heaviness of winter that troubles me. I do not wish to burden you while you're visiting our town. Please, go back and enjoy the festivities!'

'I appreciate your sympathy, [placeholder]. I think talking to you might help to ease my mind, for I can see that you have a good soul.

'You see, my friend Gareth recently found a stray paper after Guard Frostway from the town vault came to make his nightly collection for the store-house. Gareth kept the fallen record, though I told him he should return it to Guard Frostway, and he read its contents.

'I am sure he must be mistaken, but he claims that the mayor has made some very unsavoury investments of the town's money, and that is why we work as hard as we do, for so little, and why so many folks are out of work.

'I couldn't believe it, [placeholder]. I am sure Gareth read it wrong. He is angry though...I do not know what he means to do.'

'Gareth Rust found my records? And Daley Utteridge told you, a visitor, all about it? Surely he means to blackmail me. It seems you caught them just in time, for it looks as though they meant to expose me in front of everyone. Well, they will both be sorry!

'One more favour, if you please, [placeholder]. I would ask you to meet me outside of town for some unpleasant business regarding this little issue you've uncovered.

'There is a summons-horn in the woods. Use it when you're ready, and I'll come to you. I'll send word to the workers to heed the call as well. I'm afraid there shall be a bit of a confrontation....'
The mayor wants you to betray the workers...and the price is right!
'I knew we were wrong to ever trust you, [placeholder]! What is the mayor giving you for your troubles? How many loaves of bread could be bought with your reward, eh?'
Gareth Rust does not trust you now

'Ha! You showed them, [placeholder]! That was well done. Now I'll surely have enough money for this new investment, thanks to what I'll save from having to pay those two ingrates.

'As promised, here is your lavish reward. I appreciate everything you've done here!'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: This is your last chance to choose another path, and the other set of rewards.</rgb>
Daley Utteridge is reluctant to tell you anything incriminating, but he might be persuadable....

'I'll give you the short of it: the mayor is feeling a little suspicious of the workers and wants someone to spy on them to see what's afoot. What you make of this is for you to decide, but I would talk to the mayor if I were you. See if what he has to say is to your liking.\n\n<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: The rewards for both of these mutually-exclusive quests are UNIQUE to each quest. Please choose your quest carefully!</rgb>
You talk conversationally with Daley Utteridge, but he does not say anything helpful

'Ha! You showed them, [placeholder]! That was well done. Now I'll surely have enough money for this new investment, thanks to what I'll save from having to pay those two ingrates.

'As promised, here is your lavish reward. I appreciate everything you've done here!'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: This is your last chance to choose another path, and the other set of rewards.</rgb>
Daley Utteridge appreciates the comfort, but he does not wish to share his woes
Daley Utteridge appreciates your sympathy and opens up
Apparently, Gareth Rust is in possession of records of the mayor's incriminating transactions....

Sometimes you must put yourself before others, even when those others have great need. The reward is often worth it!\n\n<rgb=#FF0000> NOTE: This quest will be removed from your quest log when the current festival ends. </rgb>
You have defended yourself against the workers' anger, and taken the stolen records back from Gareth Rust
You have defended yourself against the workers' anger, and taken the stolen records back from Gareth Rust
Return the records of corruption to Mayor Goodnough to receive your reward
Inform Gareth Rust that he has lost his job (and take back the mayor's records while you're at it)
Return the records of corruption to Mayor Goodnough to receive your reward
Return the stolen records to Mayor Goodnough in town
Find out what the mayor wants from you
Convince Gareth Rust to confide in you
Try to convince Daley Utteridge to confide in you (outsider though you are)
<rgb=#FF0000>Talk</rgb> to Daley Utteridge -- maybe he will talk back
Offer comfort and <rgb=#FF0000>pat</rgb> Daley Utteridge on the head
<rgb=#FF0000>Sigh</rgb> your sympathy at Daley Utteridge
See if Daley Utteridge will tell you anything useful
Tell Mayor Goodnough everything you learned from Daley Utteridge
Use the summoning horn to call the mayor and protect him from the workers' wrath

The mayor stands in the centre of Winter-home, overseeing the events of the Yule Festival.\n\nYou should speak with the mayor and find out what he wants from you, though it sounds like he has a sleazy scheme brewing.

Gareth Rust is in the workers' area in Winter-home, toiling unhappily with his fellow workers.\n\nYou should try to get some dirt on Gareth Rust, as his negativity makes him a candidate for being let go.
Daley Utteridge stands near Gareth Rust in the workers' area.\n\nYou should see if Daley Utteridge will trust you enough to speak of the workers' unhappiness to an outsider.

Daley Utteridge is in the workers' area of Winter-home.

You should try to persuade Daley Utteridge to tell you more so that the mayor will have the information he seeks.

<rgb=#FF0000>To perform an emote, select your target and type the required emote in your chat window. (Example: '/cheer')</rgb>

Daley Utteridge is in the workers' area of Winter-home.

You should try to persuade Daley Utteridge to tell you more so that the mayor will have the information he seeks.

<rgb=#FF0000>To perform an emote, select your target and type the required emote in your chat window. (Example: \q/cheer\q)</rgb>

Daley Utteridge is in the workers' area of Winter-home.

You should try to persuade Daley Utteridge to tell you more so that the mayor will have the information he seeks.

<rgb=#FF0000>To perform an emote, select your target and type the required emote in your chat window. (Example: '/cheer')</rgb>
Daley Utteridge is in the workers' area of Winter-home.\n\nYou should speak with Daley Utteridge and see if he will share the information that the mayor seeks.

The mayor is in the centre of town among the festival patrons.\n\nYou should tell Mayor Goodnough what Daley Utteridge told you concerning Gareth Rust and the record of unsavoury transactions that now lies in his hands.

The mayor wishes for you to meet the two workers in the woods south-east of town.\n\nWhen you are ready, you should go to the woods and summon the mayor and the workers using the town's Summoning Horn.

'Ha! You showed them, [placeholder]! That was well done. Now I'll surely have enough money for this new investment, thanks to what I'll save from having to pay those two ingrates.

'As promised, here is your lavish reward. I appreciate everything you've done here!'

<rgb=#FF0000>WARNING: This is your last chance to choose another path, and the other set of rewards.</rgb>
'Don't look to me for advice, [placeholder]. It's not my role to choose, or help you choose. You must look inside yourself and do what you think is right, for yourself or for others.'
'I can't believe how you sold us out! No matter -- there are better horizons for honest men like us.'
'I can't believe how you sold us out! No matter -- there are better horizons for honest men like us.'

Mayor Goodnough is in Winter-home in Frostbluff, awaiting news of your success in the Festival Square.\n\nYou should speak with the mayor now that you have helped to save his reputation and return the stolen records to him.

Mayor Goodnough is in Winter-home in Frostbluff, awaiting news of your success in the Festival Square.\n\nYou should speak with the mayor now that you have helped to save his reputation and return the stolen records to him.
The mayor is in the woods outside of town.\n\nYou should speak with the mayor now that you have helped to save his reputation, and return the stolen records to him.
Gain and Glory: Assist the Rich
